intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. skottsbergiana, commonly known as the Skottsberg's bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
